Package view

Class ViewContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.ViewContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ViewContainer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The ViewContainer contains the JFrame for the game and uses panes to switch from view to view without having to open multiple windows during the running of the game.
    Author:
    Devon Pirestani, W Mathieu Mimms-Boyce, Dylan Martin, Andre Green, Miguel Fuentes
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewContainer

        public ViewContainer​()
        Constructor for ViewContainer. Creates a JFrame and loads a JPane into it.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(CustomMouseListener m,
                       CustomKeyListener k,
                       CodeListener c,
                       java.util.ArrayList<GameObject> o,
                       int cycles)
        Initialize adds the Listeners to the frame and initializes the view, this has to happen after the constructor because the model needs to be set up first and that requires the size of the screen
        Parameters:
        m - The CustomMouseListener for our game
        k - The CustomKeyListener for our game
        c - The CodeListner for our game
        o - The list of objects to be drawn in our game
        cycles - How far along the timer is

      • next

        public void next​(java.util.ArrayList<GameObject> o)
        Transitions the view object in our container to the next view.
        Parameters:
        o - The list of objects to be drawn in our game.

      • timeUp

        public void timeUp​(QuizModel model)
        This is only called if the view is a ObjectView but view needs to be cast to access timeUp
        Parameters:
        model - The model providing us the information for the quiz

      • questionAnswered

        public void questionAnswered​(java.util.ArrayList<GameObject> o,
                             int score,
                             boolean quizCorrect)

      • resetView

        public void resetView​()
        Clears the pane of everything drawn in it previously to refresh for the next scene.

        If this is not done the JFrame will not display properly and things will look wrong.

      • resetView

        public void resetView​(javax.swing.JComponent component)
        Removes a particular component from the pane to refresh for the next scene.

        If this is not done the JFrame will not display properly and things will look wrong

        Parameters:
        component - The component to remove from our pane

      • start

        public void start​()
        Adds our view to the pane. This makes everything visible.

      • update

        public void update​(int time)
        Repaints the JFrame after each tick.
        Parameters:
        time - The time to update our timer to

      • close

        public void close​()
        Program is set to end on window Close. This will terminate everything

      • estuaryPopup

        public void estuaryPopup​(Animal a,
                         CodeListener cl)
        Draws an EstuaryPopup on the container.
        Parameters:
        a - The Animal to be displayed on the popup.
        cl - The CodeListener to emit codes to.
